div.p: First and foremost, the authors would like to express our gratitude to the Director General of Health Malaysia for his permission to publish this paper. We thank Project Management Team for Enhanced Primary Healthcare, the State Directors of Johor and Selangor as well as primary health care staffs at both states for their contribution in this study. We would also like to extend our gratitude to the Harvard T. H. Chan School of Public Health for their inputs on the study protocols.

sec.div: Ethics approval and consent to participant
sec.p: Ethical approval was obtained from Medical Research and Ethical Committee (MREC), Ministry of Health Malaysia (ref: [ 5] KKM/NIHSEC/P17â€“350). In addition, permissions to carry out the research at selected clinics were obtained from each respective state health directors as well as the medical officer-in-charge of each clinic. Written Consent from participants was obtained prior the interview.

The dataset that support the findings of this article belongs to the Enhanced Primary Healthcare Evaluation study. Request for data can be obtained from Dr. Mohd Azahadi Omar (drazahadi@moh.gov.my), the head of sector for Biostatistics & Data Repository, National Institute of Health, Ministry of Health Malaysia and with the permission from the Director General of Health, Malaysia.
